action.action-desc: Mr. Gingrey of Georgia (for himself, Mr. Harper, Mr. McClintock, Mr. Westmoreland, Mr. Cassidy, Mr. Roe of Tennessee, Mr. Terry, Mr. Schock, and Mr. Lance) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To restore the longstanding partnership between States and the Federal Government in managing the Medicaid program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the State Flexibility Act.

section.header: Repeal of Medicaid and CHIP maintenance of effort requirements under PPACA

subsection.text: Section 1902 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396a) is amended by striking subsection (gg).
Section 2105(d)(3) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1397ee(d)(3)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in the paragraph heading, by striking Continuation of eligibility standards for children until October 1, 2019 and inserting Continuity of coverage.
Section 1902(a) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396a(a)) is amended by striking paragraph (74).
Effective January 1, 2014, the paragraph (14) of section 1902(e) added by section 2002(a) of Public Law 111–148 is amended by striking the third sentence of subparagraph (A).

subsection.text: Except as provided in subsection (c)(2), the amendments made by this section shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.
